files.title: No Responsive Documents / Rejection Letter
files.description: A letter stating that no responsive, no exempt records were found.

results.communication:
Cambridge Law Department
Cambridge City Hall
795 Mass. Avenue
Cambridge, Ma 02139

To Whom It May Concern:

I'm a journalist working on a possible piece about Freedom of Information Law.

Pursuant to the state Freedom of Information Act, G.L.M. c.4, €7, clause 26th, I hereby request copies of records on Freedom of Information Act filings in the City of Cambridge. Specifically, I am looking for:

Documentation on how many requests were filed in 2009.
The resolution (approved, denied) of those requests.
The names of the requesting individuals and/or organizations.

Ideally, I would like the cover-letter responses by  the City of Somerville to FOIL requests submitted in 2009, which I believe would include all of the above information. I agree to pay reasonable search and duplication fees for the processing of this request in an amount not to exceed $10.

In the event that fees do exceed $10, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, but hard copies are acceptable if more convenient.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Morisy
185 Beacon St. #3
Somerville, MA 02143

Daytime: (857) 488- 3081
E-mail: morisy@gmail.com

Sincerely,

files.title: Meta FOI Request for Amherst
files.description: A collection of FOI requests filed in Amherst.

results.communication:
[See Attached Document]

Hi Michael,

We lost our power yesterday so couldn't get back to you right away, but I've just gone through my records and if I photocopy the requests (2 per page as they're on half sheets), it'll come out to 13 copies.  We charge 20 cents per copy, so that would total $2.60.  Then we'd add our time into that figure at $21.00/hr, and between the time I took already searching and the time it would take to photocopy, it should run no more than 15 minutes ($5.25).  Therefore, total cost to you would be $7.85.  If this is acceptable, please mail a check payable to "Town of Amherst" to:  Town Clerk, 4 Boltwood Ave, Amherst, MA 01002, Attention:  Susan Audette.  Also please include a self-addressed, stamped envelope.

If for some reason you'd like each request on its own page, then the 13 pages would become 26 at $5.20, making the total $10.45.

Have a great holiday weekend!

Sue

[[Requested Mailed To Amy West, amy.west@state.ma.us, referrred to her by Cindy with Department of Transitional Assistance (DTA)]]

Hi Amy,

Thanks so much for your time on the phone. I'm requesting documentation about how much each grocery store is reimbursed in the state of MA from its food stamp programs. I'm interested in looking at data from the last 12 available months, preferably in a digital format.

However the data is formatted (by individual store, chain, etc.) is fine.

Thanks!

Michael

To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the state Freedom of Information Act, G.L.M. c.4, €7, clause 26th, I hereby request the following records: 

Police report and any follow up reports for a hit & run reported by Michael Morisy, reported on 10/2/09 on license plate 19626.

I agree to pay reasonable search and duplication fees for the processing of this request in an amount not to exceed $10.

In the event that fees do exceed $10, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, via e-mail attachment or CD-ROM.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Morisy
Filed via MuckRock.com
185 Beacon St. #3
Somerville, MA 02143

Daytime: (857) 488- 3081
E-mail: requests@muckrock.com

results.communication:
Good morning,

Attached please find annual Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) sales for all SNAP retailers in Massachusetts.

Note the first section of the spreadsheet displays meal service programs. The types of programs are abbreviated as described in the chart below.

I hope this meets your needs.

  • Meal Service Types
  • AD Alcohol and Drug Treatment Center
  • AT Alcohol Treatment Center
  • BW Battered Women's Shelter
  • DT Drug Treatment Center
  • GL Group Living Arrangement
  • HP Homeless Provider
  • NP Non-profit Communal Dining Facility

Cyndi Sullivan, Deputy Director
Financial Program Management
Department of Transitional Assistance
Phone Number Redacted

files.title: Annual_SNAP_query.xls
files.description: Food stamp reimbursement data for January to May 2010, including reimbursement totals given to stores through the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program.

results.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the state Freedom of Information Act, G.L.M. c.4, €7, clause 26th, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all e-mails and related materials provided to the State House News Service and/or the Associated Press in response to Freedom of Information requests for e-mails regarding the proposed health insurance rate cap instituted April 1st, as referenced at the following URLs:

http://www.bostonherald.com/news/opinion/editorials/view/20100715policy_vs_the_spin/
http://www.businessweek.com/ap/financialnews/D9GUQG880.htm

and including but not limited to e-mails from and to Barbara Anthony, a government employee serving as the undersecretary of consumer protection.

I also request the initial requests filed by the  State House News Service and/or the Associated Press that lead to the e-mails release.

I agree to pay reasonable search and duplication fees for the processing of this request in an amount not to exceed $5.

In the event that fees do exceed $5, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, via e-mail attachment or CD-ROM.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Morisy
Filed via MuckRock.com
185 Beacon St. #3
Somerville, MA 02143

Daytime: (857) 488- 3081
E-mail: requests@muckrock.com

Dear Mr. Morisy,

Thank you for your email regarding your request for certain records under the Freedom of Information Act. The Office of Consumer Affairs and Business Regulation provides consumers with basic information about their rights and responsibilities.

Your request has been passed on to our General Counsel, Diane Lawton. If you have any question, you may contact her by phone at 617-973-8707.

I hope you find this information helpful.

Sincerely,
J. Rayo
Consumer Information Specialist
